sentences.english: Many people still cling to the old customs and beliefs.
sentences.chinese: 许多人仍然固守旧习惯和信仰。

sentences.english: At first, it was easy to allow my old habits to swallow me.
sentences.chinese: 最开始，我的旧习很容易就吞食了我。

sentences.english: As Jefferson had discovered earlier, however, old practices die hard.
sentences.chinese: 然而，诚如杰斐逊之前的发现，旧习难改。

sentences.english: Old habits are hard to break.
Old habits die hard, especially when there's money to be made.
sentences.chinese: 旧习难改，尤其有利可图的时候。

sentences.english: Joining the euro meant that countries could carry on with old habits for longer.
sentences.chinese: 加入欧元意味著这些国家可以继续固守旧习。

sentences.english: I hate to see these old customs.
Old habits will sometimes be resurrected unconsciously.
sentences.chinese: 旧习惯有时不知不觉地又冒了出来。

sentences.english: We all hold these old customs in detestation.
sentences.chinese: 我们都非常嫌恶这些旧习惯。

sentences.english: Old habits will sometimes be resurrected unconciously.
sentences.chinese: 旧习惯有时不知不觉地又冒了出来。

sentences.english: What new behavior can you introduce to replace your old habit?
sentences.chinese: 你有什么新行为可以提出来取代旧习惯呢？

sentences.english: And when we get stressed out, we go back to old habits.
sentences.chinese: 当我们没有了压力，我们就会重拾旧习。

sentences.english: Artistic originality here is likened to the murderer of convention.
sentences.chinese: 而在这里独创艺术就像是谋杀了旧习的杀手。

sentences.english: There is no old habit but may be cured by a strong will-power.
sentences.chinese: 只要意志坚强就没有改不了的旧习惯。

sentences.english: This is actually a terrific time to create new habits or to shed old ones.
sentences.chinese: 现在正是培养新习惯，改掉旧习惯的绝佳时机。

sentences.english: Get yourself out of situations that can trigger your old habit.
sentences.chinese: 远离那些可能再次触发你旧习惯的地方。

definition: old habits are hard to change (idiom)
to continue the same old routine/to carry on just as before/to procrastinate
to follow old patterns/to imitate existing models/to continue along the same lines
(idiom) to continue in the same old rut/diehard conservative attitudes
to get rid of the old to bring in the new (idiom); to innovate
old system/weights and measures of former times
